New Records: The partnership of 170 is the highest for any wicket in a men’s T20 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Jos Buttler and Alex Hales produced a devastating display of hitting to power England into the final with four overs to spare
England win the match by 10 wickets
Virat Kohli is out, and if that doesn’t isn’t worth an exclamation mark then I don’t know what is!
Pandya pulls another to deep square.
Kohli drives two through extra cover to bring up his usual half-century: 39 balls, four fours, one six.
Pre-Game Insights: England won the toss and bowl
India have done this before,” writes Tim de Lisle, “right down to the match-losing fifty from Kohli.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler’s verdict: [Is that the perfect game?] It feels that way, against such a good side.
Rohit Sharma’s verdict: It’s pretty disappointing. I thought we batted pretty well at the back end, but we were not good enough with the ball.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weather forecast for Sunday is mixed. I say ‘mixed’; it’s rubbish. There’s a reserve day on Monday, but the forecast isn’t great then either.
The player of the match is Alex Hales
